an5.43:4.1: Then the householder Anāthapiṇḍika went up to the Buddha,
an5.43:4.2: bowed, and sat down to one side.
an5.43:5.1: “Householder, these five things that are likable, desirable, and agreeable are hard to get in the world.
an5.43:5.8: These are the five things that are likable, desirable, and agreeable, but hard to get in the world.
an5.43:6.1: And I say that these five things are not got by praying or wishing for them.
an5.43:6.2: If they were, who would lack them?
an5.43:7.1: A noble disciple who wants to live long ought not pray for it or delight in it or pine for it.
an5.43:7.2: Instead, they should practice the way that leads to long life.
an5.43:7.3: For by practicing that way they gain long life
an5.43:7.4: as a god or a human being.
an5.43:8.1: A noble disciple who wants to be beautiful ought not pray for it or delight in it or pine for it.
an5.43:8.2: Instead, they should practice the way that leads to beauty.
an5.43:8.3: For by practicing that way they gain beauty
an5.43:8.4: as a god or a human being.
an5.43:9.1: A noble disciple who wants to be happy ought not pray for it, or delight in it, or pine for it.
an5.43:9.2: Instead, they should practice the way that leads to happiness.
an5.43:9.3: For by practicing that way they gain happiness
an5.43:9.4: as a god or a human being.
an5.43:10.1: A noble disciple who wants to be famous ought not pray for it, or delight in it, or pine for it.
an5.43:10.2: Instead, they should practice the way that leads to fame.
an5.43:10.3: For by practicing that way they gain fame
an5.43:10.4: as a god or a human being.
an5.43:11.1: A noble disciple who wants to go to heaven ought not pray for it, or delight in it, or pine for it.
an5.43:11.2: Instead, they should practice the way that leads to heaven.
an5.43:11.3: For by practicing that way they gain heaven,
an5.43:11.4: they are one who gains the heavens.”

an5.43:12.4: heaven, and birth in an eminent family—
